snippet: There is no disputing that developing more jobs in different fields would be better for New York, and the country, than fighting financial regulations.
abstract: Editorial laments reports of continuing Wall Street losses, noting that it will cause pain for New York City as well as the banking industry; urges New York politicians to focus on developing new and different status jobs, instead of demanding a weakening of the financial rules that crimp banks' profitability.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

snippet: Mas (la grillade) is a restaurant of rare restraint and craft, where a chef who talks the talk of letting ingredients speak for themselves actually follows through.

snippet: A new restaurant in the West Village is smart, snug and just the right amount of elegant.
abstract: Julia Moskin reviews Tremont on Bank Street in the West Village.

snippet: The syrup is the sweetener of the moment among chefs who are digging deep into the Southern pantry and finding new ways to cook the food they grew up with.
abstract: Sorghum is the sweetener of the moment among chefs who are digging deep into the Southern pantry and finding new ways to cook the food they grew up with; unlike molasses, a byproduct of sugar production, and cane syrup, which is boiled down from sugar cane juice, sorghum syrup comes from squeezing the green juice from the tall stalks of a cereal grain and boiling it in open pans until itâ€™s thick and golden.

headline.main: Sorghum Speaks With a Sweet Drawl
headline.print_headline: Sorghum Speaks With a Sweet Drawl
